fields.description:
When using ProForma, on requests that do not have any form configuration, issues can't be created.

After clicking submit a spinner shows up then after some time disappears but no issue is created and the user stays on the request create form page.
fields.summary: Can't submit requests when using ProForma on the new Service Desk portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Customer portal logo not available

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access in your browser address bar the link straight to your customer portal:
* https://<INSTANCE_URL>.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/2

h3. Expected Results
In case there is a customized logo it should appear right next to the Portal Title.

h3. Actual Results
No logo available.

h3. Notes
It does not impact the New Help Center layout:
* [Check out the new help center!|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/blog/2017/08/check-out-the-new-help-center]

If you access the portal through Help Center then the logo appears as expected.

h3.Workaround
* Access the portal through Help Center link
* Activate the New Help Center
fields.summary: Customer portal logo not available

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The begin of the page content is cut off when configuring the layout of the page in a specific way.

h3. Environment

Knowledge base on new help center view.

h3.Steps to reproduce

# Create a confluence page with the layout of a single column.
 !Screen Shot 2018-10-04 at 16.46.08.png|thumbnail! 
# Configure the knowledge base on a service desk project;
# View the knowledge base on the new help center view.

h3. Expected results

The table should fit on the knowledge base view, it happens to texts too.
 !Screen Shot 2018-10-04 at 16.46.50.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual result

The beginning of the table is cut off.
 !Screen Shot 2018-10-04 at 16.48.12.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Change the page layout to Full-width.
fields.summary: KB article viewer page content truncated on the left on new portal view when using single column layout on the Confluence page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When displaying a File List page from Confluence on the Service Desk (Knowledge Base), the customer will be able to download individual files but not from the "Download all" button.
h3. Environment
 * JSD cloud
 * Confluence Cloud
 * Wiki space integrated with "anyone with JSD access can access the space" on the JSD project.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a File List page on the integrated space and attach some files;
 # Open the page through the Service Desk portal as a customer;
 # Click on the *Download All* button
 !file_list.png|width=600!

h3. Expected Results

The zip containing all files should be downloaded.
h3. Actual Results

It asks for the account:
 !ask_to_login.png|width=400!
h3. Notes

The download for individual files works as expected.
h3. Workaround

Download each individual files.
fields.summary: KB article with file list asks to login to download all files

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Date Time Picker show "Invalid date" when the customer change 
the language in the Customer Portal.

The issue was reproducible when using the following languages:

norsk, Tiếng Việt, русский (Россия), magyar (Magyarország), Dansk, suomi, íslenska (Ísland), Dansk (Danmark), polski (Polska), Eesti (Eesti), Tiếng Việt (Việt Nam), polski, 中文 (中国), svenska (Sverige), 日本語 (日本), русский, íslenska, suomi (Suomi), 中文, Eesti, Norwegian Bokmål, svenska, magyar, norsk (Norge)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a request type and add a field "Date Time Picker".
# Login as a customer and change the profile language.
# Select the request type and select a date and time.
# Try to open a request.

h3. Expected Results

The request is created.

h3. Actual Results

It shows the error "Invalid date format. Please enter the date in the format "dd / MMM / yy h: mm a"." on their respective language.
fields.summary: Invalid date format (Date Time Picker) when the customer changes their profile language in the customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Can't preview video attachment using the attachment macro (knowledge base)

h3. Suggested Solution
Drag and drop the video and then preview.

h3. Why this is important
The customer has to download the video and play instead of directly previewing it from the page.

h3. Workaround 
NA
fields.summary: Allow preview of video using the attachment macro

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, customers are unable to configure the data shown in a report is in minutes, hours or days.  The report automatically scales the relevant chart axis based on the data that is currently displayed.  For example:
|| y-axis is in Minutes|| y-axis is in Hours||
| !image1.png|thumbnail! | !image2.png|thumbnail! |

Testing has shown that reports with data values of >90mins will still display in minutes.  The threshold(y-axis changing to "hours") is most likely around the 120min. mark, but this needs to be confirmed.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Allow a minutes, hours, days, months, etc. timescale on the report axes 

h3. Why this is important
* Allow customers to have more control regarding how data is displayed in a report
 
h3. Workaround 
* No known workarounds
fields.summary: Custom Reports: Configurable timescale

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when clicking the Open/Close link for the Organization , the JQL is as below :-

{noformat}
reporter in organizationMembers("OrganizationName") AND NOT resolution = Unresolved AND project = XXX AND "Customer Request Type" is not EMPTY
{noformat}

This will only return the list of issue which the reporter is still active and in the organization member list. It will be better it also will include issue that is created by user was a member of the organization which already deactivate their account. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Use the JQL below :-
{noformat}
organizations in (<Organization name>) AND NOT resolution = Unresolved AND project = XXX AND "Customer Request Type" is not EMPTY
{noformat}

This will list all the issue shared to the organization.

h3. Why this is important
Makes more sense to the admin to get list of issue for the organization.

h3. Workaround 
Get the list of issue from issue navigator or create a queue for the organization.
fields.summary: Change the organization JQL when retrieving the list of issue for Open/Close ticket

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The Give Feedback popup is not populating the "I'm giving feedback mainly around" field drop-down while giving a feedback through the portal.

h3. Environment

View and customize the help center.

h3.Steps to reproduce

# Go to the project settings;
# Visit the portal settings;
# Click on View and customize;
# Click on Give Feedback;
 !Screen Shot 2018-10-02 at 15.51.51.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected results

The drop-down should be populated with some values.
 !Screen Shot 2018-10-02 at 14.25.35.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual result

The drop-down is not populated and the feedback cannot be submitted.
 !Screen Shot 2018-10-02 at 14.25.55.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Give the feedback though Jira and not portal.
# Click on the profile picture;
# Then Give Feedback.
fields.summary: Give Feedback button is not populating the drop-down in the customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the REST API to retrieve attachment from Service Desk request will return all the attachment whether it was shared to public or internal. 

h3. Suggested Solution
{noformat}GET /rest/servicedeskapi/request/{issueIdOrKey}/attachment{noformat} will provide visibility information whether the attachment is public or internal.

h3. Why this is important
It helps the admin to get the information from REST API response.
fields.summary: REST API to retrieve attachment with visibility information

fields.description:
Hi team,

I’m trying to create a request/issue using the JSD rest API but I’m not sure which fields are available and required when calling:

https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/#api-request-post

In JIRA Rest API, we do validate the data using the Get Create/Edit Issue Metadata before calling the API.

https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-api-3-issue-createmeta-get

Is there something similar for JSD Rest API? As far as I know, fields allowed in issue creation through Jira Rest API may not be available during a JSD request creation through JSD Rest API.

For example, issue description may not be necessary when creating an issue, but it may be a required field when creating a request. I would need to know this for this description and other fields to act accordingly

Cheers
Fernando
fields.summary: Add 'Create/Edit Request Metadata' methods to JSD Rest API

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When sending e-mails with attachments to custom JSD mail channels, there is a very small chance that this attachment won't be uploaded to the issue. JSD has no retry mechanism in order to avoid this.


h3. Environment
* Only cloud instances with Jira Service Desk 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
(!) This is not 100% reproducible as the fail is due to network connectivity issues, so the chance it is very small and depends on the network.

# Send an e-mail with attachments to a JSD mail channel.
# Check the issue on JSD


h3. Expected Results

In case that a connectivity issue happen (which depends on X factors that not only Atlassian's infrastructure), JSD will attempt to retry the upload in order to mitigate the chance of failure.


h3. Actual Results
The attachment is not uploaded to the issue created/commented an error like the following is added to the ticket's description:

{code}
An error occurred while attaching <<FILENAME>>: com.atlassian.jira.issue.attachment.store.media.MediaApiStreamAttachmentStore$FailureMediaApiResponseException: [AttachmentUploadFailure] Could not upload temporary attachment
Failure: Failure
{code}
fields.summary: JSD Mail channel has a small chance to fail the attachment upload to issues

fields.description: When a linked issue on a ticket transitions to done/completion, we want to notify stakeholders. But we don't want to notify stakeholders when linked issues transition in general. Would like to have ability to set trigger to transitioning to a specific status only
fields.summary: Allow service desk automation to trigger on linked issues transitioning to a specific state/status rather than triggering on transitions in general

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-5439].
  {panel}
We need the ability to include an organization into another one.

This feature will allow us :
 * To reflect customer organization into Service Desk : Some customer companies have separate projects and we want to notify/share tickets depending on the project
 * Share tickets opened for the main organization with all sub-organization users. 
 * Allow us to manage easily partner users that work for several distinct customers.
fields.summary: Ability to include an organization into another one

fields.description: We are looking any feature where admin/agent can upload/update document at one place and all users (Agents+ Customers ) can able to access it.   Is there any way we can achieve this without going through Knowledge base - confluence  .
fields.summary: How to upload single document i.e contact list in Jira service Desk.

fields.description:
It would be great to have the possibility to add Support photos so that customer can see the team they are asking for help. I added the example. 

Please let me know if it's possible. 

!https://trello-attachments.s3.amazonaws.com/5b7a73acd9ba2a451c144830/5bad052083a977767f7fbd84/e6ae19841e99cfd98ca8c1d5f09f00e7/image.png!
fields.summary: Support Portal Customization ( Possibility to add photos of Support Specialists)

fields.description:
h2. Summary

If Widget create API received fields not registered in the request type,
fields.summary: Widget request creation fails if it received unknown field

fields.description:
Our company uses Jira Service Desk for many things, developers, Facilities, and Help Desk.  It would be nice if only the Help Desk project had a landing page with the search feature predominately displayed verses hidden in the upper right corner.  Ideally if it could display suggested KB articles and Request types just for that project would be great. 

The way it is now, a general user can search for "phone issues" and see several options for various teams that work with our phone system. Those other teams of 2nd and 3rd level support and should not be the first contact for general users.
fields.summary: Individual landing pages for different projects in Service Desk Portal

fields.description:
Seen on single production instance - hello.atlassian.net

the link for customers is generated as <atlassian-domain>/browse/*undefined*/servicedesk/customer/portal/<deskid>/<issuenum>

!image-2018-09-26-12-23-30-821.png!
fields.summary: 'URL for Customers' generates an 'undefined' URL

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Request Types "hidden from portal" are still searchable on customer portal.

h3.Steps to reproduce

# Hide a request type from portal;
# Access the portal and search or the exact name of the hidden request type.
 !Screen Shot 2018-09-25 at 12.29.02.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected results

The request type should not be shown on the portal search.

h3. Actual result

The hidden from portal request type is still searchable.
 !Screen Shot 2018-09-25 at 12.29.11.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Request Types "hidden from portal" are still searchable

fields.description:
h3. Summary

With the new customer portal UI, some of the request types in the dropdown are inaccessible on a smaller screen.

h3. Environment

New help center view.
Using Chrome on a 15" laptop with a 1920 x 1080 resolution.

h3.Steps to reproduce

# Have only one public portal with only one group with more than 4 request types.
# Enable the new help center view;
# Access it anonymously;
# The drop-down of request types is cut off.

h3. Expected results

When zooming out to 80% all request types are shown.
 !Screen Shot 2018-09-25 at 11.44.09.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual result

At 100% the request types are cut off.
 !Screen Shot 2018-09-25 at 11.43.55.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Disable the new Help center view.
fields.summary: Request types in the customer portal are cut off on smaller screens

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using Italian language, these random characters appear "{1} {0}" 

h3. Environment


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a service desk project
# Setup Italian language under "Language Support"
# Make the language default 

h3. Expected Results
Text should be translated correctly.

h3. Actual Results
1. In "Customer Notification" > "Customer invited": 
The template will have the random characters  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
**Original text: {code}Welcome!
You've been invited to ${portal.name} portal. You can use this to raise requests and get help.
To finish setting up your account, simply click on your [sign-up link|${invitation.url}]. {code}

This affects the customers' signup because they don't have links to signup in the email

2. In the "Add customer" screen:  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
** Original:  !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
non
fields.summary: Random characters in service desk project when language set is Italian

fields.description:
Currently, when issues are exported to MS Word or printed, the *Approval* information is not included in the export.

It would be very useful if this functionality can be provided.
fields.summary: Allow export of approval information in service desk issues

fields.description:
Hi Support,

One of our customer support specialists thought that allowing multiple attachments to be selected and deleted at once would be a good improvement and does have valid use cases for our organization.  

 

From his ask: 

"Users only have the ability to delete one “attachment” at a time.  If there was a way to select multiple attachments, and delete them all, that would be great.  In this case, all of these “attachments” are unnecessary, as they are auto-generated by our end users email response."

 

If there is any further information or clarification I can provide, let me know!

 

Thanks!

Alex
fields.summary: Allow multiple attachments to be deleted at the same time

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Error *There was a problem retrieving tickets from this queue. Please contact your administrator* is constantly showing up when a user is viewing tickets in the queue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access any queue and the error will be shown

h3. Expected Results
The queue will just display without any errors.
h3. Actual Results
Error *There was a problem retrieving tickets from this queue. Please contact your administrator* pops up when accessing queue.
 
h3. Notes
This does not affect any tickets to not load as tickets are loaded successfully yet an error is displayed.
fields.summary: Error "There was a problem retrieving tickets from this queue. Please contact your administrator" keeps displaying

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition

The request type dropdown list, while on the issue view, seems to not have any defined order.
 !Screen Shot 2018-09-14 at 15.58.28.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested resolution

It would be great to have the ability to reorder the request type dropdown list, in order to be easier to find a specific request type.
fields.summary: Ability to reorder request type dropdown list

fields.description: When being added as a customer to an organization with over 500 requests. Retrieving a list of my issues on the customer portal yields a blank page. Furthermore querying the API for a list of issues shared with the organization times out.
fields.summary: Customer Organizations with too many shared requests timeout when fetching list of requests

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unable to generate an export of 'Portal only customers' using the Firefox browser
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to the instance on the Firefox browser (standard browsing mode or private window)
 # Navigate to 'Jira Administration > User Management > Jira Service Desk > Portal only customers'
 # Click on the 'Export users' button

h3. Expected Results
 # File should be exported successfully

h3. Actual Results
 # No prompt saying that the file was exported and is ready for download
 # No download file in the Downloads folder
 # A busy 'spinner' appears next to the button for a few seconds
 !Screen Shot 2018-09-20 at 9.35.44 AM.png|width=246,height=92!

h3. Workaround
 # Use a different browser, e.g Google Chrome
fields.summary: Unable to export 'Portal only customers' using Firefox

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
This is really simple and other Service Desk tools offer this and have for years.

We are configuring our JSD to auto-assign based on work-load. However, when an Agent is off (sick, vacation, leave, etc) they should be able to mark themselves as Offline or Away and will be omitted while in that status for a ticket to be assigned to them either automatically or manually.

h3. Suggest resolution

Create a section where an admin can set an agent as "Unavailable" and not show the agent in the dropdown list during this period.
fields.summary: Ability to set an agent to "Unavailable"

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Configuring with an automation on the issue creation step will not send the request created or request participant notification.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Set Issue Created customer notifications to send to All Customers.
 # Add an automation rule to JSD project to trigger on issue create. Action is to set the assignee to myself;
 # Email with a request participant (in this case I added my other email to the cc field);
 # my cc'd email will not receive a notification;

h3. Expected results

The notification to the request participant should be generated.
h3. Actual result

The notification is not generated.
h3. Workaround

Removing the webhook and automation rule will fix the notifications
fields.summary: Customer Notifications are not being sent to Request Participants on request creation

fields.description: Add customer to Organization without Email notification
fields.summary: Add customer to Organization without Email notification

fields.description:
*Problem*
After a customer creates a ticket, it will not redirect them to their list of open tickets.

*Suggestion*
Redirect them to their list of open tickets after a ticket is created.
fields.summary: Add a redirection to the list of open requests after creating a ticket via the Customer Portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary

New knowledge base view is delaying to display recent actions, like KBs recently created or added to categories.
h3. How to reproduce #1
 # Create a category
 # Add KBs to the category
 # Refresh or click under the category you've added the KB

h4. Expected result 

You will see the KBs that have just been added.
h4. Actual result

The KB is not being listed, taking around 5 minutes to reflect the reality.
h3. How to reproduce #2
 # Click to create a new Knowledge base
 # Publish the newly created knowledge base
 # Go back or refresh the Jira Service Desk project's knowledge base screen

h4. Expected result

The newly created KB will be listed under _All articles_.
h4. Actual result

The KB is not being listed, taking around 5 minutes to reflect the reality.
fields.summary: New knowledge base view is delaying to display recent actions, like KBs recently created or added to categories.

fields.description:
When I access my main service desk customer portal page, I see dropdown which width is ~85px. After opening, all requests are mile long because of width, which is too small.

With this bug, then main page is not very much usable, because people can't properly see request types.

 

Link to image (attachments not allowed) https://1drv.ms/u/s!AmUxD9V7MQKqgap0dy86fnH5nsspgQ
fields.summary: Bugged width of Issue type picker

fields.description:
There are several projects in our JSD instance with no request types, we DO NOT want the customer to be able to submit any new tickets. We do, however, want them to be able to view tickets that were previously created in that project.

The answer that I've found before is to just remove all customers from the project and then lock the project down, but then our customers wouldn't be able to view their current tickets, and agents wouldn't be able to create new tickets and assign them to customers.

I think a good solution would be to HIDE the project button/card on the customer portal if the project has no request types visible on the portal. That way we have the flexibility to hide if we need to or to add in new types and make it visible again. THANKS!

*Edit: forgot to mention, right now it's frustrating from a customer perspective because they try to click on these 'empty' projects and instead, get an empty drop-down with no options. So from a UX perspective hiding the project card altogether would be ideal.
fields.summary: Hide projects on customer portal that have no request types

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Request types are showing incorrectly where only the icons can be seen if the request types are grouped only into a single group. This issue only occurs when the customer is restricted to a single portal only.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Group all request type in a project into a single request type group
# Access the portal as a customer who is restricted to a single portal only

h3. Expected Results

h3. Actual Results
Only the request type icon can be seen
 !Screen Shot 2018-09-14 at 6.42.50 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
The behavior is not consistent when request types are grouped into 2 groups. It appears to be dependant on the number of request types in the group too.

h3.Workaround
Divide the request types into multiple groups.
fields.summary: Request types are not displayed correctly when request types are grouped in a single group

fields.description:
h3. Description

If customer portal has a request type drop down with many request types and it is opened on an attached monitor (resolution: 23.5-inch (1920 x 1080)). It works fine when opened on the laptop screen (resolution: 15.4-inch (2880 x 1800) MacBook Pro). Zooming out helps to display screen properly. A customer reported to successfully reproduce this on a Windows-based PC resolution 1920 x 1200 with the Orientation as Landscape.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Setup a customer portal with 5 or more request type arranged in a drop down. The portal should enough fields to fill the screen
 # Open the portal on a screen with resolution 1920 x 1200 (or more) with the Orientation as Landscape

h3. Expected Result

The portal should display correctly by adjusting accordingly with screen resolution
h3. Actual Result

The portal display as few request types are hidden when the drop-down is expanded to show request types.
h3. Workaround

Zoom out or scale the resolution to high enough to display properly.
fields.summary: customer portal does not adjust screen if opened on attached monitor

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As an Agent, I can see a ticket on the Portal but I cannot add myself via Share button.
 Customer permission setting: Other customers in their organization. If they're not in an organization, they won't find anyone.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a user to the Jira instance in the jira-servicedesk-users group
 # Do not add this user to the service desk project.
 # Add "any logged in user" to "Browse Projects", "Service Desk Agent", "Create Issues" and "Edit Issues"
 # Log in as the agent.
 # Go to the Portal view to see a request
 # Try to Share it with yourself

h3. Expected Results

Agent can add himself to the ticket via the Portal
h3. Actual Results

Agent cannot add himself. No visible error
h3. Notes
h3. Workaround

Go to the Jira issue view and add yourself there
fields.summary: As an agent I cannot add a participant on the Portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When JIRA-user profile is in French, the approvals section of an issue isn't displayed. This also requires the approval condition to be "percentage type" a.k.a. "All approvers" required to reproduce.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # First check your project settings in issue types
 # Check for the approvers issue type
 # Make sure the workflow for it has "All approvers" required for approval - if not switch it to "all approvers"
 # Create a ticket with multiple approvers.
 # Set your profile language to French
 # Browse an issue where the Issue-type have pending approvals

h3. Expected Results

The pending approval section is displayed accordingly
h3. Actual Results

The message below is displayed:
{noformat}
Erreur de rendu de 'com.atlassian.servicedesk.approvals-plugin:issue-view-approval-statuses-web-panel'. Veuillez contacter vos administrateurs Jira.
{noformat}
h3. Notes
h3. Workaround

There's no workaround available. It is required to switch the profile language to another one.
fields.summary: Approvals rendering error when user profile is in French

fields.description: My team's customers are internal employees. I want to know about our customers' experience and collect the data to improve team's performance. As you can imagine, one may not be candid in giving a lower score to their colleagues knowing the agent is able to see who gave a negative feedback for them. I want a permission on customer satisfaction report to make it available to admins (team leads and managers generally).
fields.summary: Option to make customer satisfaction report available to only admins

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The calendar field does not scale on the smartphone screen size on the new view of help center.
The keyboard pops when selecting a calendar field.

h3. Environment

- New help center view on the mobile browser;
- Google Chrome browser.
- Screen size 4.7 inches and below.

h3.Steps to reproduce

# Enable the new help center view;
# Add a calendar field to the request type;
# Access it using a mobile browser, with a smartphone with a screen size of 4.7 or below.

h3. Expected results

The calendar should scale with the smartphone screen size and the keyboard should not pop too.
E.g. Screen Size 5.5 inches:
 !WhatsApp Image 2018-09-12 at 18.24.22.jpeg|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual result

The calendar does not scale and some dates are not selectable.
E.g. Screen Size 4.7 inches (September 25th):
 !20180912_143953000_iOS.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Use the portal on a desktop browser.
fields.summary: Calendar field does not scale and keyboard pops on smartphone browser

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* Users who don't or forget to log out remain logged in after the browser is closed and/or the machine is restarted

h3. Suggested Solution
* Implement an optional session cookie that site-admins(org-admins) can toggle/configure
* Implement a "Remember me" button

h3. Why this is important
* Quite common for organizations to "hotdesk" or share a pool of machines for specialised uses(events, conferences, meetings, etc.)
* Potential security issue
* Important to note that some users may want to _stay_ logged in so it's important that admins/users have some control over the cookie
 
h3. Workaround 
* Client-side workaround would be to configure the browser to clear cookies for the Cloud instance either by the local/domain administrator(s) or by the end user themselves
fields.summary: Session Cookie

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Users without Service Desk application access, but with Administer Jira global permission can't access any customer portal.

h3.Steps to reproduce

# Create a group without any application access and add it to Administer Jira global permission;
# Create a user without any application access and add the created group;
## It happens with any other application access; 
# Try to access a Service Desk portal.

h3. Expected results

The user should have access to the portal as a customer.

h3. Actual result

The error "you don't have access to any portal" shows.

h3. Workaround

Remove the group that has the Administer Jira permission.
fields.summary: Users with Administer Jira, but without any application access can't access any portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When the Reporter and Assignee of a Service Desk request are the same Jira user, a valid Jira user with SD Agent permissions, Jira will suppress any Internal Comment notifications for this user.
 "Share with customer" comment type works just fine.
h3. Steps to reproduce:
 # Create a SD project
 # Create a request or use an existent
 # Change the Assignee and Reporter of the request to be the same user
 # Do an internal comment > the notification doesn't work

h3. Expected

The user should receive the notification because he/she is also the Assignee of the issue.
h3. Actual

The user won't receive the notifications for the internal comments. Add yourself as watcher doesn't solve the problem.

h3. Workaround

Use "Share with customer" instead of the internal comment.

h3. Note

Although the symptom is similar to JSDCLOUD-5067, the cause might be different from it.
fields.summary: When the Assignee and Reporter of the issue are the same, JSD suppress this user notification

fields.description:
What are the chances you guys are thinking of creating a way to communicate with customers in Jira Service Desk directly from Trello?

 

What if, inside the service desk customer portal accounts, they were all made 'members' (automatically) to a Trello board?  Collaboration in both Trello and Jira Service Desk.

 

Just a thought.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Trello integration with Service Desk accounts

fields.description: When searching in the Help Center in Service desk it would be nice to have the ability to jump to the specific section on a page based on the keyword used.
fields.summary: Improve Help Center results with anchor links

fields.description: It would be handy to have the functionality to do the accounting of support hours clients have purchased. Some businesses sell support hours to clients and want to have reports available on remaining balance hours for each client. It would make sense to have this kind of reporting along with real issues in the service desk.
fields.summary: provide ability to do accounting of support hours for clients

fields.description:
Currently, the Customer Satisfaction (CSAT) is immediately sent upon a "Resolved" status being reached. This, unfortunately, can be premature if the resolution is not accepted and the ticket is reopened. 

If we were able to add a delay to the CSAT this can help reduce false and bad responses if the ticket was not actually resolved.
fields.summary: Allow delay for Customer Satisfaction

fields.description:
It would be very helpful when doing major changes or testing to the portal if we could enable a "maintenance" page for Service Desk Users but still allow admins access. 

Currently, the only workaround is using StatusPage to notify users of an upcoming update and to plan this update outside of business hours. 

 

This may be linked to JSDCLOUD-1012
fields.summary: Ability to enable a maintenance page

fields.description:
h2. Summary

Widget request creation fails if backend validation failed, for example:
 * a required fields is not supplied.
 * additional field not registered in request type is provided

This normally occurs if admins used Widget REST API in a custom form. When the problem occurs help seekers still see the confirmation message, but the requests won't be created in the queue.
h2. Steps to reproduce
 # Setup a Widget pointing to a request type with a required field
 # Submit a Widget requests via REST API without supplying the field in 1

h2. Expected

A 400 error is returned informing client about the missing field
h2. Actual

A 200 response is provided, but the request is not created in the queue
fields.summary: Widget request creation fails due to backend validation

fields.description:
h2. Summary

Widget request creation fails for returning help seekers (people that already has customer account in the JSD instance) if global system _browse users and groups_ permission is missing for the Widget app (addon) user. Help seeker will still see a confirmation message in the shopfront website, but the request will not be created in the queue.
h2. How to diagnose the problem
 # Go to Jira settings -> System -> Security -> Global permissions
 # Check if _Jira Service Desk Widget_ addon system user __ is a member of _Browse users and groups_ permission, typically this user will have this permission via the _jira-servicedesk-user_ group
 # If this permission is missing for the user, the problem described in this bug will occur

h2. Workaround / how to resolve

Ensure _Jira Service Desk Widget_ user has _Browse users and groups_ permission. Since this user is a system user, you can't edit the group membership directly, but instead you need to add the default group for the application (eg: _jira-servicedesk-user_) into the permission.
fields.summary: Widget request creation fails for returning help seekers if global system browse users and groups permission is missing

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, in JIRA and Customer Portal allow to paste screenshot. However, in Customer Portal the filename is always *image.png*. Due to that, when customer paste multiple screenshot it will display the screenshot image for all file. This is due to the feature request we have , which is [Update existing attachment with same name - JSDCLOUD-4100|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4100] . 

The behaviour is different when user paste screenshot in JIRA ticket. The filename changed. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Paste screenshot in Customer Portal will not always use *image.png*. It best to use date_time.png. 

h3. Why this is important
Due to the same filename, the customer couldn't paste multiple screenshot. They need to save the screenshot in their local drive and continue to attach it as an attachment.

h3. Workaround 
Save the screenshot in local drive and attach it as an attachment in Customer Portal.
fields.summary: Paste screenshot to Customer Portal use different filename

fields.description:
I have noticed recently that the queue page lists and the queue page counts are not being refreshed on changes.  

 

Steps to reproduce

!image-2018-09-07-20-07-06-408.png!

Have  queue like the above

Choose an issue and delete it (say via . delete dialog)

It does get deleted however neither queue items nor the queue count get refreshed.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

In the above issue 1 has been deleted but its still shown

Navigate to another queue to cause a refresh of the model

It now shows the missing issue however the queue count does not update at all

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

This is causing pain in people sitting on the queue and trying to get a picture of the work they need to get done.

For example from a customer recently

{quote}
I still cannot believe that JSD doesn't update the queue when you update the status of an issue, looks like they have increased the delay of refresh now as well 😞
Stop working on everything else and fix that!
my workflow is resolve - shift + reload, next issue..
{quote}
fields.summary: Queues issue lists and queue counts do not refresh

fields.description: Please add an option in Jira to allow admins to disable/turn off the Stride Room option within a Jira issue view.
fields.summary: Option to Remove Stride - Hipchat / Create Room link

fields.description:
h3. Summary

New help center is breaking words in half

h3. Environment

New help center

h3.Steps to reproduce

# Enable the new portal view;
# Add a big announcement message;
# Some words will be broken in half.

h3. Expected results

The announcement should be shown as in the "old" portal view.
 !Screen Shot 2018-09-06 at 15.30.10.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual result

New help center is breaking words in half.
 !Screen Shot 2018-09-06 at 15.29.45.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: New help center breaking words in half

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The "Created at" date in the Customer portal request view is showing an invalid value when profile language is set to French.
It is showing as *Aujourdhui {0}*

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set profile language to French language.
# Create a request and view the created request.

h3. Expected Results
"Created at" will show the values *Today (current time)*
h3. Actual Results
"Created at" shows *Aujourdhui {0}*
 
h3. Notes
The incorrect value only displays for requests created on the same day it was viewed.

h3.Workaround
No workaround other than using other languages
fields.summary: "Created at" date in the Customer portal request view is showing an invalid value when profile is set to French
Summary Page: Edit and Update

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you resolve an issue and your resolve screen has an attachment field, if you add an attachment and a comment the customer does not receive the attachment in their notification nor can they see it in the portal, but they can see the comment. The attachment is visible to agents within Jira.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add an attachment field to a resolve screen
# Resolve an issue and on the screen add an attachment and add a comment for customer
# The customer never receives the attachment either in the notification or the portal

h3. Expected Results
The attachment is added to the customer notification and portal view as per normal

h3. Actual Results
The customer receives only the comment. They have no knowledge an attachment was ever added.
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
Make sure to send the attachment prior to resolving the issue
fields.summary: Customer does not receive attachments added on the resolve issue screen

fields.description:
h4. Summary
If you create a custom rule with the "send email" THEN action, save it, then come back again, copy the automation rule 
and edit the content of the "send email" section, the content of both branches will overwrite each other and changes will not be saved.

h4. Steps to reproduce:
 # Create a custom rule with an IF condition and a "send email" THEN action.
 # Save the rule.
 # Go into the rule again, click on the "*...*" menu and duplicate the automation rule . It will copy the IF and THEN configuration from the previous line.
 # Enter some content on the new "send email" action and save the rule.
 # Go into the rule again.
 # Click to edit the "send email" section.

h4. Expected result:
Each THEN action has different content

h4. Actual result:
Both THEN actions have the same content.

h4. Workaround
After copying the rule, deleting the "send email" THEN action  and recreating it should workaround the issue.
fields.summary: Changes to "Send email" automation rules are not saved when the branch is copied

fields.description:
Currently, if we have a customer that belongs to more than one organization and we click on "View open" or "View closed" the JQL is filtering tickets by the reporter and not by organization.
It means that if the customer chooses to share with Organization1 and then an agent click on "View open" for Organization2, the ticket that the customer opened will show on Organization2 as well.
It would be great if the JQL that the link points changes to, for example, *Organizations = Org1* instead of *reporter in organizationMembers(Org1).*
fields.summary: When clicking on "View open" or "View closed" it returns tickets shared with other organizations

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Using a custom icon for a request type will be graphically malformed on the "Recently used forms" section of the new help center view.

h3. Environment
* Turn on the new help center view 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Turn on the new help center view on a JSD project from the Portal settings 
# Go to Project settings > Request types :  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# Upload a custom icon for one a the request types
# Go back to the portal page

h3. Expected Results
The newly uploaded icon should appear proportional

h3. Actual Results
The uploaded icon appears not proportional: -  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
Only on the "Recently used forms" sections on the Help center is showing this behavior
The icon appears fine on the request creation form:  !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Custom request type icons appear graphically malformed on the new help centre view "Recently used forms" section

fields.description:
Hi, 

Currently there is an option to create issue under Jira Service Desk Automation Rules. This presents some limitations that the custom fields from the source issue cannot be copied and used in the create issue option. Please can you extend this functionality to include the option to Clone the issue under Automation Rules. 

Thanks
fields.summary: Allow Cloning option under JSD Automation Rules

fields.description:
Hi Team,

We have just started using Jira Service Desk and we have listed below our doubts. Need your assistance in understanding them.



1. When a ticket is raised which requires someone's approval, then how is the approver notified ? 
2. How to change Issue type within the same ProjectCurrently, as per tool if we want to change te issue type let's say from Service Request to Incident, then it can be only done by moving it to different Project and then select the Issue Type
3. Why the issues are coming in descending order of Key inside iDMCP2.x project, whereas it's coming in ascending order inside iDMCP Service Desk Project 
4. When we try to change Issue type of a particular ticket(ISD -4, from Service Request to Change), then it tells to move the ticket to another Project(from iDMCP Service Desk Project to iDCMP2.x project). After moving the ticket(ISD-4) to iDCMP2.x, the ticket is still under the queue of iDMCP Service Desk Project with changed Issue type(Change) and not iDCMP2.x project 
5. Time to resolution starts after default of 8hrs. How to configure that ? 
6. Currently there is no time out session for Jira Service Desk User. How do we configure it for security purposes ? 
7. Is end user notified about our actions or comments in each stage of ticket ? 
8. How to define SLA depending on the combination of Issue type and Priority ? 
 

 Thanks.
fields.summary: Doubts on Jira Service Desk

fields.description:
Problem Definition
Because of GDPR, JSD reports now does not include the username anymore for portal-only Jira Service Desk users but include the QM code.

Suggested Solution
Replace the QM code by a GDPR-compliant information that would be more useful and user readable.
fields.summary: Include the email address instead of the QM code for JSD customers on the JSD reports

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

GZIP is not enabled on the Widget JS server, what increases the file size.

h3. Suggested Solution

GZIP should be enabled on the Widget JS server.

h3. Workaround

There's no workaround available.
fields.summary: Enable GZIP compression on Widget JS server

fields.description:
h3. Description
If a customer replies over a message received by an agent and he is a member of a group with browse Project permissions the comment is added internally.

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Atlassian Account without Application access (customer)
# Create a Group
# Add the user to the group above
# Browse to project Settings > People 
# Add the group to the project with a Role which *has* Browse project Permissions.
# Create a ticket with the customer created in step one.
# Comment on the ticket with the user
# Ask the Assignee of the ticket(or any agent that it has received the notification) to forward this message to the customer account created in the step one.
# Now with the customer account, forward the message received from the agent to JIRA Service Desk mail handler.

h3. Expected Results
The message should be added as a public comment.

h3. Actual Results
The comment is marked as internal and we are not able to change the visibility of the comment.

h3.Workaround
You can remove the user from the Group with browser permissions or remove browse permissions for that group/role.
fields.summary: Customer comments are added internally

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, upon successfully creating a request, the portal will just show the request which has been created without indicating request is successfully created and they can close the page or click on the home button to return home.
h3. Suggested Solution
Display a message indicating the request is successfully created with the request ID and buttons to close or create a new request.
fields.summary: Display a message that the request is successfully created with the request ID and buttons to close page or return to portal home

fields.description: It would be useful to have the CSAT scores as a statistic type for use in gadgets. For example you could see at a glance how many 1 star ratings an agents has gotten or 5 stars etc
fields.summary: Add Satisfaction (CSAT) as Statistic Type for dashboard reporting

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When exporting data from an old jira instance to a new one, the JSD project exported to the new instance has the same embedded key (even when changing anything) in result, widgets displayed in Marketplace are still pointing to the old one.

h3. Root Cause
Both instances had a different clientKey but the key/snippet didn't change because that data is saved in Jira as project entity properties, and was exported/imported when they imported in the new instance

h3. Fix
Widget pointed to the right instance

h3. Workaround
For now, comment it here and we'll update it for you
fields.summary: Widget points to the old instance after exporting jira data to the new instance

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, in Customer Portal KB , user couldn't search with two or less character. 

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a KB with "How to be happy" title.
# Then, go to Customer Portal to search the KB.
# Search using *To* word. 

h3. Expected Results
The article will be appear in the suggestion list.

h3. Actual Results
There's no result
 !Screen Shot 2018-08-29 at 9.12.11 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
If the user search with more that one word and "to" is one of the word , the "to" is ignored. For example, search for "to happy" . The article "How to be happy" is displayed.

h3.Workaround
(If there is no workaround directly say so)
fields.summary: Knowledge base search doesn't work with two or less character

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The translation on the JSD customer signup page has incorrect translations.



h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Send an invite to a JSD customer
# When filling in their full name and password the translations could be improved

h3. Expected Results
Vítejte v systému zákaznické podpory společností <Service Desk Name>

Jste skoro tam - jen potřebujeme uložit uživatelské jméno a heslo abyste se
mohli přihlásit.

h3. Actual Results
Vítejte na <Service Desk Name>

Jste skoro tam - jen potřebujeme zachytit heslo, tak se můžete přihlásit později.
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
No known workaround
fields.summary: Incorrect Czech translation on customer signup page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the customer notification language send to the customer is depends on the user profile. 

h3. Suggested Solution
The notification language is based on "Request Language" value.
fields.summary: Customer notification language is depends on "Request Language" value

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a customer portal set as a login-free portal, the notification should follow the default language. For example a default langauge is "France". When the second language is set to either "English (UK)" or "English (United State)" , the notification is send with English language. However, when the second language is other than English , the notification is send with default language which is "France".


h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set project language support default with "France". 
# Set the second language with "English (UK)"
# Set the Customer Permission as "Anyone can send a request without logging in"
# Then, open the customer portal and create an issue using a non existed customer email for "Email confirmation to"

h3. Expected Results
Request created notification is send in "France" language.

h3. Actual Results
Request created notification is send in "English" language.

h3. Notes
I tested setting the second language to "Russian" , the request created notification is send with "France" language , which is the expected result.

h3.Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Customer notification doesn't follow the default language support

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Request Type column in queues no longer displays the request type icon in the new Jira UI

h3. Environment
* New Jira UI

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# View a queue in Service Desk
# Notice the request type column no longer displays the request type icon

h3. Expected Results
The request type icon is shown as it was previously

h3. Actual Results
Only the text is shown without an icon
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
No known workaround
fields.summary: Request Type column in queues no longer displays the request type icon since new Jira UI

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when a ticket is transitioned and a public comment is added during the transition, the customer will receive one email only with the Request resolved template and the public comment added template in a conversation format separated by a line break. But, because each event is still using the defined notification template this makes the email received repetitive (repeats the intro and closing of the email template) and looks messy.



h3. Suggested Solution

Create a template specifically for when a request is resolved and a commented is added by the agent. This way, there is no need to repeat the header and footer or intro and closing of the email template for each event. So when a request is resolved and a public comment is added by the agent, the template used should state this issue is resolve and include the agent's comment as well.
fields.summary: New notification template for issue resolved event and public comment event when performed at the same time

fields.description:
It would be very handy if a mechanism is provided to send relevant KB articles to customers when they raise new service desk requests via email.

These articles can come from the relevant KB (Confluence space) configured with that particular JSD project and can be selected based on the email subject or the email body.
fields.summary: Suggesting relevant KB articles to customers when issue raised via email

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the customer need to drag and drop email from Outlook to local drive before drag it to the Customer Portal. There's no options to directly drag from Outlook. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the user to drag and drop the email directly from Outlook to Customer Portal as an attachment.

h3. Why this is important
Better user experience when needing to attach email.
fields.summary: Ability to drag and drop email from Outlook to Customer Portal as attachment

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Not able to mention users on Add Comment Automation.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom automation rule
 # *WHEN:* Any event type
 # *THEN:* Add Comment
 # Type @ and try to search for a user.

h3. Expected Results

It should bring a list of users that have permission to be mentioned.
h3. Actual Results

At the console, we receive a 404 error due to the project key being set as undefined.

Request URL: https://<INSTANCE_URL>.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/user/viewissue/search?projectKey=*undefined*&maxResults=10&username=<QUERY>
h3. Notes

The alert trigger is working as expected and retrieve the users in order to mention them.
h3. Workaround

Check the username under User management:
 * https://<INSTANCE_URL>.atlassian.net/admin/users

Then on the automation insert the following value:
{noformat}
My comment .... [~USERNAME]
{noformat}
You can also use the alert automation instead of comment in case you do not need to customize the message.
fields.summary: Not able to mention users on Add Comment Automation

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, Statuspage need to be manually updated. It's best if JIRA Service Desk can automatically update to Statuspage when a certain ticket created. For example an incident or change feature ticket created.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow an automation to update Statuspage based on issuetype/ reques type.
fields.summary: Allow Statuspage automatically updated when a JIRA Service Desk ticket created based on issue type/request type

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
 * There is a limited list of variables for notification templates currently available on JSD Cloud - [Managing service desk notifications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/managing-service-desk-notifications-732528936.html?_ga=2.54554594.816440628.1534640528-728617734.1526974931]

h3. Suggested Solution
 * Allow custom variables or variables for each Jira/JSD field
 * Include variables for things like current assignee, current user, etc.

h3. Why this is important
 * More flexibility in personalising customer notifications
 * Contributes to a more positive customer experience

h3. Notes
* ${event.user.name} exists for customer notifications as a message variable - something like this for templates would be  beneficial

h3. Workaround
 * No known workarounds
fields.summary: Customer notification template: include more variables

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After migrating from Server to Cloud I cannot edit my existing SLA due to error

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Import JSD project with more than 30 SLA goals from Server to Cloud
# Try to edit existing SLA goal

h3. Expected Results
It is possible to edit existing goal

h3. Actual Results
There is an error on the screen and it's impossible to save change
 !_EAC2C-320__Unable_to_save_changes_to_SLA_JQL_on_ADM_project_in_Hello_Jira_-_Jira.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Contact Support team to increase maximum SLA goals for the project
fields.summary: Cannot edit existing SLA if exceeded max limit of goals

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If you have allowed anyone to send a request to your service desk, currently when a customer sends in a ticket for the first time we use the email address of the customer as their full name when it would be better to use the included name from the email address.

For example the header does contain the name of the sender:
{noformat}From: John Doe <johhny@doe.com>{noformat}

h3. Suggested Solution
Extract the name portion of the FROM header and use that for their portal only customer's full name instead of the email address

h3. Workaround
Edit the customers name manually from Site Administration or ask customers to update it themselves from the portal > profile
fields.summary: When a customer submits a ticket via email it should use the full name of the sender instead of the email address as the full name for Jira

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When exporting an issue to Word format(either from Issue Navigator or directly on the issue), the values for the "Organizations" and "Request Participants" fields are not displayed in the resulting .doc file.
h3. Environment
 * JSD Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a test issue where a reporter

h3. Expected Results
 * In the .doc file, the correct values for the "Organizations" and the "Request Participants" fields are shown

h3. Actual Results
 * This is an export of an issue where the "Organizations" and "Request Participants" fields have a value set:
 !Screen Shot 2018-08-22 at 11.59.36 AM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
 * As long as the "Organizations" field or "Request Participants" field has a value set, the exported .doc file will not have the values shown as _blank_.
 * This bug applies to portal, email or JSD originated issues
 * The behaviour when the "Organizations" and "Request Participants" fields don't have a value set is correct, the field values are displayed as "None"
 !Screen Shot 2018-08-22 at 11.59.42 AM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
 * It's possible to create custom fields and create a [workflow post function|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/advanced-workflow-configuration-776636620.html#Advancedworkflowconfiguration-postfunctions] to copy the field values on transition and have the data displayed in the custom field instead of the original fields
* The post functions can be added to as many transitions within a workflow as required
* For "Request Participants", a "User Picker (multiple users)" custom field can be used
* For "Organizations", a "Text Field (multi-line)" custom field can be used
*  Example custom fields:
 !Screen Shot 2018-08-22 at 2.55.31 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2018-08-22 at 2.54.46 PM.png|thumbnail!
* Example post function on a transition:
 !Screen Shot 2018-08-22 at 2.56.30 PM.png|thumbnail!
* Example exported .doc file:
 !Screen Shot 2018-08-22 at 11.59.06 AM.png|thumbnail!
* Notes: the field will only update when the issue is transitioned(and a post function exists)
* It might be possible to use a [jira:issue_updated webhook|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/jira/platform/webhooks/] to listen for events and then use REST API to fetch/copy(update) the relevant fields.  Please keep in mind that third-party development is outside of our standard support scope and we are unable to provide assistance with scripting.  For more information, please see:
** [JSD Cloud REST API|https://developers.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/#api-request-issueIdOrKey-participant-get]
** [Jira Cloud REST API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/#api-api-2-issue-issueIdOrKey-get]
** [ScriptRunner for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/6820/scriptrunner-for-jira?hosting=cloud&tab=support] has a ["ScriptListener"|http://scriptrunner-docs.connect.adaptavist.com/jiracloud/script-listeners.html] feature which allows a script to run when a webhook event has been triggered.  ScriptRunner is supported by the add-on vendor - Adaptavist.
fields.summary: Word Export: Organizations and Request Participants field values are not displayed
Attaching files from the customer portal results in server error 500

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
It can be quite common for email only customers to not even realise they have a portal only account nor visit the portal and as such never update their preferred language.

And because they have only used email the profile defaults to English or the project default and does not use their browser language.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow a jira-administrator to set preferred language of customers, or provide an automated way of sending translated responses based on accounts or email addresses etc.

h3. Workaround
Ask the customer to log into the portal and update their preferred language
fields.summary: As an Administrator I would like to be able to set a language for customers

fields.description:
h3. Problem
When an agent looks at the view request page inside the portal, if a new issue is required, the agent needs to get back to the initial menu to open.

h3. Suggested solution
Add a "create issue" button to the view requests page inside the portal.
fields.summary: Add a "Create issue" button to view requests page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, there are no reports to identify
* what articles are the most popular
* how many users use the KB
* what "key words" are the most popular in searching
h3. Suggested Solution
Implement reports or allow to customize reports to obtain such information.
h3. Why this is important
 These reports would allow support to improve their services by identifying which areas to focus on.
fields.summary: Report on Service Desk usage

fields.description:
There are several automations I want to create using the current agent who is interacting with the ticket. This is not available as a choice and it should be. For example, I want to assign unassigned tickets to the first agent who replies. This should be really simple, but it't not a choice in the edit issue for Asignee field.

!image-2018-08-17-10-12-10-135.png!
fields.summary: Add "Current User" to the choices in Automations > Edit Issue

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the knowledge base pages will only listed once the customer search it. 

h3. Suggested Solution
It will be best if the KB pages listed in Customer Portal. Maybe create a page in Customer Portal to list all KB exist for that project.

h3. Why this is important
 Some end user wouldn't know what to search, by listing it out will make things easier for the end user.
fields.summary: Ability to list all the knowledge base existed for that project instead of the customer need to search it

fields.description:
Now in our Customer Portal there are two levels of pages: Help Center / Our Comany Helpdesk

The first one is general and customer has to choose our customer portal to create an issue. After creating the ticket he clicks on "Help Center" (or our logo) and is redirected again to "Help Center" (this general page where he doesn't see all requests types).  

Which is not user-friendly. Is there possibility to be redirected only to our Company Customer Portal (this view with requests types)?
fields.summary: Customer portal - redirection

fields.description:
# Send an email with attachment file name contains special character like ":", for example "Atlassian Attachment:018287.pdf" to Service Desk email channel

Expect
Issue will be created and attachment is added

Actual
Issue was created but attachment is skipped
fields.summary: Email attachment with special character in the file name is skipped on request creation

fields.description: Service Desk admins/Project admins should be able to send the satisfaction comments to agents
fields.summary: Send satisfaction comments to assignee

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In some cases, the JQL functions seem to ignore the project context and retrieve the approval information from external projects.

Affected functions are: approver(""), pendingBy("") and myPending().
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create two projects. Project A and Project B.
 # Create a "multiple user picker" custom field (ex: Team A) and set a few users as its a default value (example: John). Leave the context as "global".
 #  In *Project A*
 #* Create an approval step, where the approvers will be picked from "Team A" field.
 #* Make sure to add the "Team A" field to the required screens
 #* Create a few issues and check if they correctly pending on "Team A" members approval
 # In *Project B*
 #* Create an approval step, using the regular "Approvers" field.
 #* Create a few issues and check if they correctly pending on approval.
 #* Make sure that the "Team A" field *is not included* on the project's screens.
 # Go to the "Issue navigator" and perform the query: {{Approvals = pendingBy("John")}}

h3. Expected Results

Only issues pending on John's approval will be retrieved (all from Project A).
h3. Actual Results

Some issues from Project B will be incorrectly retrieved by the query.
h3. Notes

Although the Team A field will exist in the context of Project B (and also hold it's default value), the field is not associated in any approval step on the project, thus its issues should not be retrieved by the query.
fields.summary: JQL approval functions are incorrectly retrieving results.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there's no option to edit "Fix Version" field using automation.

h3. Suggested Solution
It will be best to include the field.

h3. Why this is important
 Admin will be able to edit the Fix Version.

h3. Workaround 
Use [Automation for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1215460/automation-for-jira?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] plugin
fields.summary: Ability to edit "Fix Version" field using Automation

fields.description: It would be very useful to customize the announcement banner to show/hide on a page-by-page basis. For example, hide the banner when a customer views their list of support tickets.
fields.summary: Allow control to show or hide announcement on a page-by-page basis in the portal

fields.description: It is important as part of managing queues in service desk to determine which organization is reporting incidents and/or logging requests to us. Currently in the dashboard, Organization field is not included as Statistic Type. Requesting to have this available as option for more efficient analysis on requests/incidents we are receiving.
fields.summary: Add Organization as Statistic Type for dashboard reporting

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using label custom fields in the portal, if you enter a new label name in the custom field and attempt to reuse it on another ticket it is never suggested and you must create it again.

However, if you have the default system Label field in the portal and add a new label name, the next time you use the custom field label it will provide suggestions from the system default Label field.

Essentially the only labels suggested and remembered are ones that have been entered into the system default label field. Any labels entered into a custom label field will never be suggested when trying to use again.



h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom label field
# Add both the system default label field and also your custom label field to a Request Type
# Create a new ticket from the portal, enter a new label into the custom label field, leave the system default label field blank
# Create another ticket and in the custom label field attempt to re-use the same label from the previous ticket, the label is not found and no suggestion made
# Create a new ticket and this time enter a new label into the system default label field
# Create a new ticket and attempt to re-use the label from the previous ticket/step. Notice it is found and suggested for both label fields

h3. Expected Results
After entering a new label name into a label custom field, next time you should be able to re-use the same label without creating it again

h3. Actual Results
The only labels ever suggested are ones that were entered into the system default label field
 
h3. Notes
This only occurs within the portal, when creating a ticket from within Jira previous labels from custom label fields are remembered and suggested

h3.Workaround
No known workaround
fields.summary: Labels field only provides suggestions from the system default Label field in the portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Jira does not translate the month on date picker fields on the new help center view.

h3. Environment

New help center view in French.

h3.Steps to reproduce

# Go to the service desk project settings;
# Add a date picker field on a request type;
# Add French as a supported language;
# Enable the new help center view;
# The date picker field does not accept the date format.

h3. Expected results

Jira should translate the month to French.
 !Screen Shot 2018-08-14 at 11.49.55.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual result

Jira does not translate and the error "Please provide a valid value for the required date field" is thrown.
 !Screen Shot 2018-08-14 at 11.51.35.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Set the French as the default portal language or use the "old" help center view.
fields.summary: Date picker does not work correctly in French on new help center view

fields.description: With the new UI update it only shows "99+" next to the open issues queue. Monitoring this number is important for our org and I'm sure many others. It's annoying to not have a real time count that's easy to see and check on a moment's notice.
fields.summary: Show total ticket count on All Open Issues queue.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a customer is a member of multiple organizations and the same customer creates a request via email, the request isn't shared with _any_ organizations. The expected behaviour is that(by design/expectation) JSD should share the newly created issue with members of the same organization as the reporter.
h3. Environment
 * Jira Service Desk Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create 2 organizations
 # Add a customer account to both organizations
 # Send in a request via email as a test

h3. Expected Results
 * The newly created issue will be shared with the organization(s)

h3. Actual Results
 * The newly created issue isn't shared with any organizations

h3. Notes
 * When creating a request via the customer portal, a customer can only select a single organization at a time, but agents in JSD are able to associate/share a single issue with multiple organizations
 * If customers are only supposed to share issues with 1 organization at a time(current customer portal behaviour), then the "Organizations" field in the full issue view in Jira needs to be changed to a single group(organization) picker - otherwise multi-organization sharing support should be added to JSD so customers can share with multiple organizations from the portal or via email

h3. Workaround

Using the third-party add-on: [Automation Lite for Jira Cloud|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1215670/automation-lite-for-jira-cloud?hosting=cloud&tab=overview], an automation rule can be created to match "if customer is a member of <org1> and <org2>, then edit the issue to include <org1> and <org2> in the Organizations field". For support/advice in making this work, please contact the add-on vendor directly - [Code Barrel Support information|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1215670/automation-lite-for-jira-cloud?hosting=cloud&tab=support].

Example rule:
 !Screen Shot 2018-08-14 at 4.00.36 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Email Request: Organizations field not populated if customer is a member of multiple organizations
